articles.author: Samantha Libreri
articles.title: How coronavirus can be trasmitted
articles.description: Of the 24 people who have tested positive for Covid 19 in the Republic of Ireland, the majority (14) have been linked to travel from affected areas. A number of the cases have been as a result of local (7) and community (3) transmission.
articles.content:
Of the 24 people who have tested positive for Covid-19 in the Republic of Ireland, the majority (14) have been linked to travel from affected areas.
A number of the cases have been as a result of local (7) and community (3) transmission.
As cases increase, … [+1179 chars]

articles.author: RTÉ News
articles.title: Six dead as Italian prisoners protest over coronavirus
articles.description: Prisoners have taken to the roof of a prison in the Italian city of Milan as part of a series of violent country-wide protests against coronavirus measures, in which six inmates have died.
articles.content:
Prisoners have taken to the roof of a prison in the Italian city of Milan as part of a series of violent country-wide protests against coronavirus measures, in which six inmates have died.
In another incident, around 50 inmates broke out of jail in the south… [+4193 chars]

articles.title: Cheltenham gets green light despite coronavirus
articles.description: Officials at Cheltenham on Monday said it was "full steam ahead" for the start of the Festival on Tuesday.
articles.content:
Officials at Cheltenham on Monday said it was "full steam ahead" for the start of the Festival on Tuesday.

articles.author: RTÉ News
articles.title: Coronavirus to drive European airline industry shakeout
articles.description: The coronavirus will accelerate a Darwinian shakeout in Europe's overcrowded airline industry that ultimately benefits Ryanair and Aer Lingus owner IAG, industry experts predict.
articles.content:
The coronavirus will accelerate a Darwinian shakeout in Europe's overcrowded airline industry that ultimately benefits Ryanair and Aer Lingus owner IAG, industry experts predict. 
Nobody is exempt from the short-term pain that has already seen Flybe collapse… [+5030 chars]

articles.author: Vincent Kearney
articles.title: GAA club shuts down as coronavirus case detected
articles.description: One of the biggest GAA clubs in Belfast has closed its clubhouse and suspended all training and matches after a member tested positive for coronavirus.
articles.content:
One of the biggest GAA clubs in Belfast has closed its clubhouse and suspended all training and matches after a member tested positive for coronavirus.

articles.author: RTÉ News
articles.title: World stocks sink on coronavirus shock, oil price crash
articles.description: Global share markets plunged this morning as panicked investors fled to the safety of bonds and the yen to hedge the economic trauma of the coronavirus.
articles.content:
Global share markets plunged this morning as panicked investors fled to the safety of bonds and the yen to hedge the economic trauma of the coronavirus.
Oil plunged more than 30% after Saudi Arabia opened the taps in a price war with Russia.

articles.description: As the spread of Covid-19 escalates in Ireland, essential services, including energy and water companies, and transport operators, have put in place contingency plans.
articles.content:

articles.title: Indian Wells event cancelled due to coronavirus fears
articles.description: The BNP Paribas Open at Indian Wells will not take place due to concerns about the coronavirus outbreak, organisers have said.
articles.content:
The BNP Paribas Open at Indian Wells will not take place due to concerns about the coronavirus outbreak, organisers have said.
